title: A fruit seller had 24 kg of apples. He sold some of these apples at 20% profit and the rest at 5% loss. If he had made 10% profit on total fruits, then how many apples did he sell at a loss? - Quora

response.answer_text: let x kg fruit sold with 20%profit (24-x )kg fruit sold with 5% loss Total profit = 10% 1.2x+(24-x) *0.95 = 1.1(24) 1.2x + 22.80–.95x = 26.4 0.25x =3.6 X = 3.6/0.25 ie : 36*10/25 X = 14.4 kg At 20% Profit sold apple =14.4 kg At 5% loss sold apple : 24–14.4 ie : 9.6kg Ans : 9.6 kg

Let us assume that X Kg of apples sold at 20% profit and (24-X) Kg of apples sold at 5% loss and overall 24 Kg of apples sold at 10% profit. Then 120x/100+95(24-x)/100=110*24/100 120x-95x+2280=2640 25x=2640–2280=360 X=360/25=14.40. He sold 14.40 Kg at 20% profit and 9.60 Kg at 5% loss.
